title.rendered: Telegram vs Slack, which is better to communicate at work?

content.rendered:
Everything related to teleworking has not stopped growing over the last few months. That is why users have had to get used to using various communication platforms to maintain contact with colleagues. There are many solutions in this regard, as is the case with the popular Telegram and Slack.

For years we have been able to use solutions of this type that allow us to hold virtual meetings and remote communications via Internet. But from a few months to this part, the use and proliferation of these online services has not stopped growing. Its developers, fully aware of all this, have tried to improve their own projects as much as possible. All in order to make things easier for the millions of customers who might need and make use of their applications and platforms.

It is worth mentioning that we use all this habitually both from desktop computerssuch as through mobile devices. It is for all this that we are going to talk about two of the most common and used proposals below: Telegram and Slack. And it is important in this sense to select the one that interests us the most depending on the functions that they are able to offer us. Keep in mind that not all users have the same needs at work when it comes to communicating with their colleagues. Hence the importance of choosing the internet platform for what interests you the most.

The truth is that both platforms and their corresponding applications are very interesting for this type of professional task. Each one with its pros and cons, which allows us to choose the one that most interests us in each case.

Differences between Telegram and Slack to talk at work

So that you can opt for the most interesting option depending on your needs, first of all, we will talk about the differentiating advantages that the Telegram application offers compared to Slack:

  • For securityoffers a point-to-point encryption system in communications.
  • Instantly notify when a message has been read by receiver.
  • We can see the last connection of the companions.
  • We have the possibility to send files of free voice.
  • The use of dated media files of expiration.
  • Share contacts with other users.
  • It offers a multitude of informative groups of interest.
  • It’s totally free.

On the other hand, in this sense and to also communicate with other coworkers, Slack presents us with its own advantages, as we will see below:

  • It is specially designed for business group work.
  • We don’t need a mobile terminal to sign us up.
  • The desktop application It is very intuitive and full of functions.
  • Its design is especially suitable for communicating with multiple online users.
  • Integrates with cloud storage services.

As we can see, both options are very interesting for most users who need to communicate with co-workers. From there and depending on the functions that each one needs, we can opt for one option or another. Certainly for large companies with multiple departments and groups, slack is a more interesting option. On the other, for SMEs that also do not want to pay a single euro, they may be more interested Telegram.
